Reviews.Title: Works as expected
Reviews.Author: Amazonian "From deep in the Amazon"
Reviews.Content: I installed 4 of these over 4 months ago, and they have been working very well.  I also installed two other cameras, from a different manufacturer that provide a live feed to the house, so these NightWatcher cameras are for backup/alternate angles (and also for their motion tracking lights).  Since the NightWatchers record directly to their on-board SD cards, they are not useful for live-monitoring.  However, they work well in their designed capacity.  The tracking function is really cool, and seems to make for an intimidating deterrent.One tip: One of my NightWatcher lights was coming on every time a car drove by on the street, because the motion detection has a pretty long range.  I made it "near-sighted" by placing electrical tape over the upper portion of the motion detection window on the NightWatcher.  Now, it only "sees" when there is motion on the driveway and near the garage. Perfect.  Raise or lower the tape on the window to adjust the range.I am satisfied with these camera/lights.

Reviews.Title: No support from Nightwatcher
Reviews.Author: H. Johns "Broken Nightwatcher"
Reviews.Content: I bought and installed model 700 a week ago and it started shutting down and just flashing a green light in the sensor window after 4 days of operation.  I have reset it daily and it would work for several hours and then stop again.  I have tried to seek assistance to correct the problem from "Nightwatcher" to no avail.  Three notes and three phone calls later I still have no response from "Nightwatcher".  Light and camera would be great IF IT WORKED and if Nightwatcher had any support for their product.  I purchased it based on Amazon and and HomeDepot carrying the product online and expected their support from their brand name would lend credit to the product.  IT DOES NOT and it has changed my opinion of purchasing through Amazon or HomeDepot in the future.  No returns...no support...no response after spending $245.

Reviews.Title: Spent $250 for 4 days of security.  This sucks!
Reviews.Author: cardsfan3007
Reviews.Content: Bought this to protect myself from insane neighbors and after 4 days it's already broken.  Stopped going from side to side, just stays pointed in one direction at the wall and light won't turn off.Luckily it's not too hard to put up, since now I'll be taking it down again.  Just mad at how worthless this thing is.  I had a feeling this would happen, but I figured $250 would allow me to at least use it for 6 months to a year.  I would have been satisfied with that but 4 days is pathetic. Stay away, don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy - Item Does Not Work as Advertised
Reviews.Author: Ajdx4
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product and had it professionally installed.  It worked for approximately 2 weeks before, like other reviewers experienced, the product stopped working.  The light would no longer turn and the light would no longer turn on and off as it is supposed to.  The alleged "re-set" button does absolutely nothing.  Do not buy this product unless you enjoy being ripped off.  There is no customer support offered by Nightwatcher which tells you everything about the company you need to know.  They do not stand behind their product.

Reviews.Title: Junk

Reviews.Content: Installation was fairly simple, and it seemed to work as advertised but it broke after a week. I predict they'll be out of business soon.

Reviews.Title: I'd Wait...
Reviews.Author: tsunamiscott
Reviews.Content: There is no sensitivity adjustment, and a small 2 GB maximum memory card limit, so the recorded history is less than 24 hours in our location. Switching to photo mode extends the recording time, but we are stuck with thousands of photos to look through. Our 2 cats, and the local raccoons, keep this unit very busy even though it's mounted 7' off the ground.I'd wait for the next generation before buying.

Reviews.Title: Didn't even work in the store
Reviews.Author: Cincinnati Stuff "Now accepting applications ...
Reviews.Content: They now sell these at Costco for about $160. They had a display but it was unplugged. I plugged it in and it started right up and tracked myself and other people in the aisle about four times. Then it froze. We tried hitting the reset button and it still wouldn't work.We found that the only way it would start working it again was if you unplugged the display for about 30 seconds and then plugged it back in. Reviews.Title: Watching you
Reviews.Author: S. Paladino
Reviews.Content: This was a great purchase. Easy to put up and easy to use. Only problem I ran into was it was a little hard to see the little led light when you are changing settings. Also the time/date setting screen was a little hard to read. Most of the problem was I was doing it in the bright sun. Toward evening it was easier to read the  screen. I would buy this again and tell all my friends about it.

Reviews.Title: Saved My Ass!
Reviews.Author: Bill Kinyoun
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these at Costco after my garage was broken into twice.  Third time was a charm!!  Perfect video of the little bastards breaking in and stealing tools and a scooter.  Cops used the video to ID the perps, tracked them down and retrieved all my belongings.  One got 30 days in county lockup and the other was in county lock up for 2 months before being sentenced to 18 months at the cross bar hotel.  Now word is out that I have video surveillance and no one will come near.  Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Light broke weeks after purchase, no response from customer service
Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: I was pretty excited with this light when my contractor installed it - the motion tracking was like something out of a sci-fi movie and everyone who came to our home seemed to delight in dashing across our driveway trying to outsmart it.  However, the enjoyment didn't last long - a few weeks after it was installed, it began staying on literally all night, wildly scanning the yard even when there was no movement to be found.  It was, frankly, creepy - and I'm sure my neighbors across the street didn't appreciate the constant bright light and frantic movement.  I tried for weeks to email/call customer service and never heard back.  (And it wasn't just my unit - my contractor had bought the same light and reported similar issues.)That was a little over a year ago.  Eventually (once the weather got warmer?) the light started functioning as usual and I forgot about it.  But we're back into winter here, and sure enough the light started doing the same thing.  And then, all of sudden, the bulb just went out.  It's an LED so I can't imagine (even with constant use) that the bulb actually died, but somehow, even though the unit still tracks movement, it doesn't light up anymore, ever.  It's been weeks now without a functioning light.  Wondering if maybe it will right itself when it gets warm again... but what good is a light that only works three seasons a year?Now the company's phone number is out of service, and I imagine I am out of luck.  This thing is going in the garbage, and if this company somehow manages to survive, I certainly will never buy another of their products.  Stay FAR FAR AWAY from this one!

Reviews.Title: It has it's good points and it's weaknesses
Reviews.Author: Richard Matsueda
Reviews.Content: This is one very interesting and unique products I have seen. I bought my first at CostCo, but they stopped carrying it for some of the reasons listed in the reviews. The support and directions are very poor which is very unfortunate. If you stop the movement of the light, your first thought is "that it broke", but all you need to do is to disconnect the power source and then reconnect it for it to start working again. The product is also all plastic, so it will break easily if you drop it. It's seal around the conduit box is somewhat less than adequate (even with the gasket that comes with the product). You can use some outdoor duct tape in this area to solve the problem. The video quality is poor, but most cameras do not have great video quality (so actually is just ok). What they do not tell you is that you will need an electrician to run wiring and a conduit box to the area that you want to mount the light (similar to any other security light). The advantage of this product is that it uses a lower wattage and very bright LED light (vs a halogen light). This product has been a great help from keeping vandals and other unwanted people from loitering around my property. The light is bright and having the light follow the unwanted people seems to spook them.

Reviews.Title: Pros and cons of the Nightwatcher
Reviews.Author: Mr. P. L. Hitchiner
Reviews.Content: I have had this for about one month.DEFECTS1. Don't position it near a central heating outlet as the steam will switch it on.2. Don't position it close to ivy or trees as they will switch it on.3. On a sunny day - the sun will blind the camera - as it will shine directly into it.4. The instructions warn you not to take the sd card out if the camera is recording, but it is almost impossible to get near the nightwatcher without it coming on automatically. I took the sd card out while it was recording and it corrupted the sd card. It would not reformat and I had to throw it away.5. The sd card supplied was only 2 GB. This may be ok it the camera only switches on two or three times a day, but get a larger SD card for anything more - they are quite cheap.6. Don't try to switch it off with a bamboo cane - I did and the cane went into the switch off button and broke it.7. It needs to be positioned some distance from the area you want secure otherwise you will not be able to tilt the angle of the camera low enough.8. The camera detects the thief and switches on, but then immediately scans the other areas, only giving a fraction of a second on the thief.9. If the thief is moving then the immage is slightly blurred. If the camera then moves, then the immage is just one blur and you will not be able to recognise the thief.10. The thief needs to be within 4m (12ft) of the camera, otherwise the light will not be able to reach him. The light, however, is dazzlingly bright - too bright to welcome visitors.10. The camera should be positioned between 2m and 3m above ground. This would allow the thief to switch it off, and disconnect it, to sell in the neaarest pub.GOOD POINTSEverything else. We put one near our front door, and turned the camera to people watch in the street, rather than scan the front door. Better than watching telly.

Reviews.Title: Another piece of worthless junk from China
Reviews.Author: DebBee
Reviews.Content: I SHOULD HAVE listened to everyone else and never purchased this expensive piece of junk. How disgusting that these disreputable companies manufacture such crap and charge high prices to fool unsuspecting consumers into thinking it *might* be quality and throwing hard earned money away, not only on the junk but an electrician to put it up and take it down too. It worked fine at first, but now after a little over a month (and a 1/2 hr power outage), the piece of garbage is broken. Immediately after the power outage, it had to be re-set every night, I even tried cutting the power as the manufacturer suggested to someone else and it still didn't work right. Now, the light doesn't come on at all. It's a good thing that I have other lights around my house, or I would be in total darkness, waiting for my handyman to have a chance to come over and switch it with a regular motion sensor light. Great security feature!!! I really wish there was a law that would fine or prevent companies from doing business in the U.S., that indulge in such questionable business practices as selling worthless products that are more trouble than they are worth. I guess I should be thankful that it broke so soon and I still have the receipt and box so I can return it.

Reviews.Author: Mr. C "The real deal"
Reviews.Content: It does what it says it does..... Have had mine up for several months now, and no probles at all. I recomend getting a 64GB micro card, and using it instead of the included 1GB. I don't reallly check the stored video unless I need to; the main reason I have this is to use as an deterent. Most people have never seen a motion tracking camera, that was not being manually moved, therefore they assume that they are being watched.......Update..... Not really set up for 64 GB card. Gets kind of sketchy. Use smaller card 8-32Gb...Update #2... unit now has an issue turning the full range of motion. Sometimes it works perfectly fine, others it will not turn it all...... After this purchase, I purchased another light, but without the camera, this light worked fine for a while, but with heavy pet traffic in the backyard, this light appears to have been overworked,and now rarely functions properly. I do stand by my original statement, this light is still FN awesome issues or not.

Reviews.Title: Bright LED light with added Security
Reviews.Author: Nikola Tesla "Free Energy"
Reviews.Content: I have received this motion LED flood light almost 2 months ago and it has performed better than expected. Some lights turn on when the wind picks up but this light is smart enough to stay off and not turn on with swaying trees and bushes. For correct operation the key is setting it up properly. Get familiar with the directions before installing the light, that way you will save time getting it up and running. I put mine up in Feb., it was very cold and windy here where I live. The next day we had wind, heavy snow 8" - 12" fell, and this light tracked me during the storm with the snow falling even at night!  I observed that when an object moves passed a detected zone and if it looses track, it will hunt for the object by scanning back and forth until it finds it. If it does not find the object it will go back to the point at which it was first detected and wait until it times out. Note that all sensors are active all the time so no matter which direction the camera is facing it will always turn to where the action is even if there is action in 2 places it will watch both!  I think this light is a great idea and will be getting a new black one for the porch when it comes available other than white. Looks like the EUROPEAN models 220v are black, I need a USA 120v LED with camera.  I highly recommend this light for added security, but it is not for anyone who does not know how to program it. It is high tech and needs a skilled person to program it.Programming: Make sure the clock is set correctly and that the correct mode which you want is enabled. There is buttons on top for the video and time, on the Left side for the audio, and on the bottom for different modes. To verify proper setup, make sure your selected mode color LED is blinking,(Red,Orange,or Green), in the sensor area when motion is detected and the Green LED is on at the MicroSD card door indicating information is recording. If the MicroSD Card light is RED there is a malfunction with the MicroSD Card, format the card per instructions. You may have had a power glitch or the light is in demo mode.Mode 1 (Red LED blinking) Light only at night, Record video/pictures day/night, Alarm sound only at night. (Default Setting)Mode 2 (Orange LED blinking) Light on day/night, Record video/pictures day/night, Alarm sound day/night.Mode 3 (Green LED Blinking) Light on at night, Record video/pictures day/night, Alarm sound only day

Reviews.Title: Best Security Light I have ever bought
Reviews.Author: Papasmithnc
Reviews.Content: Love the security light.  I have had it for two years with no problems.  It is bright and since it follows motion, it is a real deterrent.  Very intimidating for most thieves.  It also has a function which will enable you to record a message such as "intruder alert, police have been notified".  You can also use one of the prerecorded sounds such as a dog barking.  It really sounds as though the dog is barking in the house in my case.  The camera is of little use in the the pictures captured in most instances are not the quality for a positive ID even if the person is not trying to conceal is face.  However, it will let you know if it is a cat prowling around or an animal of the two legged variety.I see that this item has gotten a number of poor reviews.  Let me address some of the problems.1)  "Quit working within a short period"  I have had one for 2 years and it works fine still.  I'm guessing that the light is not properly mounted to prevent water intrusion.  One person complained it quit working because it was filled with water.  Probably mounted in the open without the seal properly positioned.  I have had another traditional LED security light do the same thing.  I find that even if a security light is said to be an outdoor light, it still pays to at least to place it where precipitation does not fall directly on top of it especially if it has complicated electronics in it such as with LEDs.  With the light head being able to move and the other features of the light, there is probably more places for water to enter.  I have mine under a deck and I've had no problems.2) "Various problems with picture quality."  The whole outfit only cost $129.00 at Costco or maybe a little more depending when you bought it.  This does not contain a high quality, high megapixel infrared camera and will probably rarely work during the day, let alone at night to the point of identifying positively who the intruder is.  However, it will tell you if it is just a cat or actually someone snooping around your property and that is valuable information in and of itself.3)  Short video times.  I don't know about this but mine does several days or more before running out of space and starting over.  I mean, this is not an expensive surveillance system.4)  SD card hard to remove without erasing.  Hey, you've got to read the directions on how to do it without damaging the SD card.  Not hard to do.In summary, I have been very satisfied with my unit.  It is bright, dependable, has great motion detecting capabilities, and the head rotating to follow movement is an outstanding feature in protecting your property.

Reviews.Title: excellent features great amount of light

Reviews.Content: Great product for price. Slightly confusing instruction if you have a hard time taking it one step at a time. Overall excellent purchase.

Reviews.Title: Impressive after a few weeks
Reviews.Author: J. Tankersley
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised.  After a few weeks of use I am impressed so far.  Easy to install, easy to setup, well written manual and well labeled and very responsive to movement.  Has a very bright LED light, which should last the life of the unit and use minimal energy.Immediately turns toward movement and turns on the flood light (lights only at night and silent by default) when-ever anything moves within a few car lengths of the unit, and records 1 or 2 VGA (low res) photos per second to the micro-SD card.  (Thousands of time/date stamped photos per day, though fairly low quality and many blurry due to movement.)I recommend upgrading to a 32GB SD card (about $25 dollars) to store about a month of pictures (new pictures will save over the oldest photos if the card is full).  (I have two cards, so if I want to review pictures, I just swap cards).All-in-all, this unit is a good buy and low maintenance (no batteries to change).  Our car was broken into a few years ago, and this unit would capture that type of event in the future, or deter a similar event with its motion activated movement and bright light.I was about to purchase this unit from Amazon, but I got a better price and better warranty from Cost-Co.  So far, highly recommended for the price, 4 stars over-all.

ProductInfo.Features:
Patent-pending motorized light follows motion
When motion is detected, the motorized light points in the direction of the motion. As motion moves across the detection zone, the light will follow.
Built-in Camera will record 20 seconds of video to SD card each time motion is triggered
210 degree detection zone
Nichia super bright LEDs (8 x 1W)
ProductInfo.Name: NightWatcher Motion - tracking Motorized LED Flood Light with Color Camera
